title: @CreateDateColumn() and @UpdateDateColumn() bug on {synchronize: true} (mssql)
body:

**TypeORM version:**

[x] `latest`

[ ] `0.x.x` (or put your version here)

**Steps to reproduce or a small repository showing the problem:**

I found a bug when using the update and create custom columns provided by typeorm in mssql:
```
@CreateDateColumn()
    public createdAt: string;

@UpdateDateColumn()
public updatedAt: string;
```

When I add them in my entity and I enable **synchronize: true** in the db options the first time it runs okay and it created the tables. The second time and all the next one it crashes with this error:
```
.
QueryFailedError: Error: Could not create constraint or index. See previous errors.
    at new QueryFailedError (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\node_
modules\typeorm\error\QueryFailedError.js:27:28)
    at C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\node_modules\typeorm\driver
\sqlserver\SqlServerQueryRunner.js:265:61
    at _query (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\node_modules\mssql\
lib\base.js:1253:25)
    at Request.tds.Request.err [as userCallback] (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\node_modules\mssql\lib\tedious.js:620:15)
    at Request._this.callback (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\nod
e_modules\tedious\lib\request.js:60:27)
    at Connection.endOfMessageMarkerReceived (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\node_modules\tedious\lib\connection.js:1777:20)
    at Connection.dispatchEvent (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\n
ode_modules\tedious\lib\connection.js:863:38)
    at Parser.<anonymous> (C:\Users\FRONTEND01\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\project\project\node_mo
dules\tedious\lib\connection.js:684:18)
    at emitOne (events.js:115:13)
```
I only have two entities in my database so far and the one that I added the columns into has a OneToMany relation with the other entity. I don't know if that plays any role on resolving the issue though.
